etymologies: late 19th century (in an earlier sense). From ancient Greek νόησις intelligence, understanding, idea, concept, (plural) processes of thought from νοεῖν to see, perceive, understand, intend (from νοῦς mind, thought) + -σις

definitions: In phenomenology: a process or an act of perceiving or thinking, as opposed to an object of perception or thought; (also) the subjective aspect of an intentional experience, as opposed to the noema.
